text: Valeriy Borisov in 2004 Valery Aleksandrovich Borisov (; born September 18, 1966 in Temirtau, Karaganda Region) is a male race walker from Kazakhstan. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |DNF |20 km |- |1994 |Asian Games |Hiroshima, Japan |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |20 km |- |1995 |World Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |23rd |20 km |- |1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States |18th |20 km |- |1997 |World Championships |Athens, Greece |35th |20 km |- |1998 |Asian Championships |Fukuoka, Japan |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |20 km |- |1998 |Asian Games |Bangkok, Thailand |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |20 km |- |1999 |World Championships |Seville, Spain |21st |20 km |- |rowspan=2|2000 |rowspan=2|Olympic Games |rowspan=2|Sydney, Australia |38th |20 km |- |25th |50 km |- |2002 |Asian Games |Busan, South Korea |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |20 km |- |2003 |World Championships |Paris, France |DSQ |20 km |- |2004 |Olympic Games |Athens, Greece |27th |20 km |} ==References== * *sports-reference Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:People from Temirtau Category:Kazakhstani male racewalkers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Kazakhstan Category:Asian Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1998 Asian Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2002 Asian Games Category:Asian Games gold medalists for Kazakhstan Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Kazakhstan Category:Asian Games bronze medalists for Kazakhstan Category:Medalists at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 1998 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 2002 Asian Games
title: Valeriy Borisov
